result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adarrius A Findley

defendant.name: Findley, Adarrius A

records.addlTxt: ADA Frank Remington appeared for the State. Attorney Brian Walter Gleason appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Attorney Gleason to update the Court after Preliminary Hearings on September 20th in other cases.
Copy of corrected bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

CORRECTION TO BOND AMENDMENT ORDERED 8/11/22
CASH CASH BAIL TO REVERT TO $500 SIGNATURE BOND AS NECESSARY FOR DEFENDANT TO BE TRANSPORTED TO/FROM LINCOLN HILLS. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
and returned.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 8/11/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. in court for Adarrius A Findley.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Agent Wagner appeared via phone. Atty Gleason filed a bond motion and requesting a signature bond in both cases for Defn to be transferred to Lincoln Hills School. State has no obj as long as defn remains in custody until transported to Lincoln Hills.  Colloquy with Agent regarding custody status until transport to Lincoln Hills. CT orders signature bond for purposes of transport to Lincoln Hills only in both cases. All previously ordered conditions remain the same.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
defense

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 2

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Adarrius A Findley in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Walter Gleason Mr. in court for Adarrius A Findley.  Attorney Theresa Lewandowski for Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves for counts to be transactionally related. No objection. Court finds counts transactionally related. Officer J.Z. duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Lewandowski. Venue established. DE identified. Cross. State moves for b/o, waives argument for rebuttal. DE objects to b/o, waives argument. Ct finds PC felony was committed and binds case over.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

01:38 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Brian Walter Gleason.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
